snippet: Wendy Davis, the Democratic candidate for governor, reveals in a new campaign memoir that she terminated two pregnancies for medical reasons in the 1990s.
abstract: Wendy Davis, Democratic candidate for governor of Texas, reveals that she terminated two pregnancies for medical reasons in the 1990s, making disclosure for first time since her nearly 13-hour filibuster last year over a tough new Texas abortion law; revelation comes in her memoir Forgetting to be Afraid.
lead_paragraph: Wendy Davis, the Democratic candidate for governor, reveals in a new campaign memoir that she terminated two pregnancies for medical reasons in the 1990s.

headline.main: Texas Candidate Says She Ended Pregnancies
headline.print_headline: Texas Candidate Says She Ended Pregnancies
